channel.title: Next Generation to arrive 2012-13
channel.description: http://www.next-gen.biz/news/next-generation-arrive-2012 Ubisoft Montreal has next-gen Xbox devkits; a Sony studio has shifted focus to PS4.

item.title: Next Generation to arrive 2012-13
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:38, topic:421900”][quote author=xryz link=topic=524583.msg3817957#msg3817957 date=1321507931]
cloud gaming is still early but after the high-speed internet is more available, and less expensive, along with better technologies(video streaming balance of compression/quality/speed) to improve cloud gaming that will be where its at. im sure consoles will be gone in a couple years, this next gen could be the last gen of consoles, doubtful though; the things i listed earlier would have to be done first. plus u have to look at the economy, and world events that may delay future technologies progress…

cant wait for technologies that bring us closer to virtual reality, but thats a ways off(i believe at that time we wont have computer hardware and displays, b/c we will have computer components integrated in each of us, allowing those components to send signals directly to our brain).
[/quote]
I have to agree with the strong likelihood of no discs for these systems. The music industry is planning on converting all of their streams of music to download-only by the end of 2012.[/quote]Sounds like i’ll completely stop buying new music then.

Read full topic

item.title: Next Generation to arrive 2012-13
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“xryz, post:20, topic:421900”]cloud gaming is still early but after the high-speed internet is more available, and less expensive, along with better technologies(video streaming balance of compression/quality/speed) to improve cloud gaming that will be where its at. im sure consoles will be gone in a couple years, this next gen could be the last gen of consoles, doubtful though; the things i listed earlier would have to be done first. plus u have to look at the economy, and world events that may delay future technologies progress…

cant wait for technologies that bring us closer to virtual reality, but thats a ways off(i believe at that time we wont have computer hardware and displays, b/c we will have computer components integrated in each of us, allowing those components to send signals directly to our brain).[/quote]

He wasn’t talking about cloud gaming, though. He was referring to simply downloading the game and running it on your local system.

I have to agree with the strong likelihood of no discs for these systems. The music industry is planning on converting all of their streams of music to download-only by the end of 2012. The large console makers would follow, naturally.

Read full topic

item.title: Next Generation to arrive 2012-13
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:23, topic:421900”][quote author=nacional link=topic=524583.msg3817965#msg3817965 date=1321509118]
what do you guys think will be changed? I know the wiiu has some changes (whether you like them or not). I wonder what they’ll do.
[/quote]
Mainly just improved hardware I’d imagine, I can bet on the next Xbox having a blu ray player

[quote author=Speljohan link=topic=524583.msg3818008#msg3818008 date=1321514060]

I can imagine the prices for games would go down quite a bit; not having to ship or waste the money on cases and disks.
[/quote]Steam disproved that myth nicely. They have the same prices as retail outlets, except without the disc, manual and jewel case.

Some of the steam deals are pretty insane though.
Saw a deal a few months ago, GTA IV complete edition (GTA IV + both expansions) all for a fiver, not bad at all.[/quote]Yes, but obviously i’m talking about when there aren’t any sales.

Read full topic

item.title: Next Generation to arrive 2012-13
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

sure wouldnt see a drive to read these, http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Holographic_Versatile_Disc anytime soon. Could afford quite a bit of extra content in those games though. if consoles were to continue of the next couple decades u would definitely see some similar technology. might start seeing consoles WiDi like technologies with Tvs that dont need the boxes to receive those wireless video signals.

Read full topic

item.title: Next Generation to arrive 2012-13
item.dc:creator: @Cole1497 Cole1497
item.description:
@Cole1497 wrote:

Getting rid of disks would probably be the best choice. I can imagine the prices for games would go down quite a bit; not having to ship or waste the money on cases and disks.

But that would mean you would need more hard drive space, and if you got it wiped, you’d probably be out of luck.

Read full topic

item.title: Next Generation to arrive 2012-13
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Seriously? Considering the next batch of games probably wont even be discs? Companies are trying to get rid of leeching companies like gamefly and gamestop. Most likely console games will have their own store like Steam.

Read full topic

item.title: Next Generation to arrive 2012-13
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:16, topic:421900”]300$ every 7 years is too much for you?

lol[/quote]
The price is fine, they just need to make a base that when new updates come out you can simply have a subscription and they send you a new drive or video card in the mail that you can put in the system. Instead of just making remakes of stuff that was right before and adding another number to the end of the name.

Read full topic
